title: "No Respect...": Kamala Harris Slams Trump's "Offensive" Remark On Women
content: Kamala Harris on Thursday slammed Donald Trump for "very offensive" remarks about women as she pressed her case that his misogyny has no place in 21st century America, just days ahead of a nail-biter election.
summary: Kamala Harris on Thursday slammed Donald Trump for "very offensive" remarks about women as she pressed her case that his misogyny has no place in 21st century America, just days ahead of a nail-biter election.

title: Turban-Wearing, Smiling Australian PM Celebrates Bandi Chhor Divas

title: Microsoft Hires Meta's Former Engineering Head Jay Parikh
content: Microsoft Corp, which is struggling to bring data centers online fast enough to meet the demand for its artificial intelligence products, hired one of the engineering chiefs who kept Facebook's infrastructure humming.

title: Pak President Fractures Foot While Deboarding Plane In Dubai
content: Pakistan President Asif Ali Zardari has fractured his foot while deboarding an airplane upon his arrival at the Dubai International Airport.

title: After iPhone 16, Indonesia Bans Sale Of Google Smartphones
content: Indonesia said it has banned sales of smartphones made by Alphabet's Google due to rules requiring the use of locally manufactured components.

title: What A Donald Trump Victory Would Mean For The Rest Of The World

title: Rocket Fire From Lebanon Kills 4 Thai Nationals In Israel
content: Four Thais were killed in northern Israel by rocket fire from Lebanon, Thailand's foreign minister said on Friday.

title: 'Call Of Duty'-Style Video Emerges Of Shooting Outside AP Dhillon's House
content: A video has emerged showing several rounds being fired at Punjabi singer AP Dhillon's house in Canada. Two vehicles were also set on fire during the September 2 incident in Vancouver. The singer was not injured in the shooting.

title: Russia Fines Google $20 Decillion. That's 2 Followed By 34 Zeroes
content: The unprecedented penalty targets YouTube, owned by Google's parent company Alphabet, over the platform's decision to block Russian state-run media channels in response to Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

title: Why US Votes In November But Inaugurates New President In January
content: The United States has an electoral system and calendar unlike no other country. The nation votes in November but the new President is inaugurated in January.

title: Donald Trump May Challenge Results If He Loses, But What Are His Options
